If an intervention modifies the differential operator L to a new operator M at a time \\( t_1 \\), and we apply the Fourier transform to this scenario, will the final state \\( \\tilde{u}(k, t) \\) at any \\( t > t_1 \\) depend only on the Fourier transformed M, not on the original L?
